website_summaries.verdict: Durable and lightweight finish nailer. Plenty of excellent features that will work for most jobs.
pros: Angled magazine makes the nailer comfortable to use
Easy to control the depth of the nails
Includes 4 profile tips that allow for precise placement of the nails
Profile tips store securely in carrying case
Clearing any nail jams is a simple process
Doesn't weigh as much as some other finish nailers
cons: Some problems with nail jams and double fires

customer_reviews.title: Made in Taiwan
customer_reviews.text: They're still advertising it as "Made in USA" and that is why I bought it but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Bostich  VS ?
customer_reviews.text: For the money they make good guns, Guys turn their noses up at Bostitch. If you are looking to get on a crew, it's Max or Hitachi framers, followed by Senco. Buy a good framing gun that can be rebuilt, spend the cash and it will last you a long time. I have the Bostitch finish, Brad and a Porter Pin and they all work just fine. I keep them in their cases and I NEVER let anyone else touch them. I've never had a jam on the finish. The key here is don't let anyone else touch them, use it and put them back in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Donton

customer_reviews.title: Best Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Without any reservation I give this nail gun five stars. I have been using it for over one year and have driven thousands of nails through it. Not ever did I have a nail jamb or misfire. Never a problem of any kind. This is a wonderful nail gun; much better than I had expected. Next time I need a nail gun of any size, I will look at Bostitch first.
customer_reviews.author: Joe York

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nailer, sure and on target.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, solid, nailer by a premier company - you get everything you would expect in this. There are several "heads" for the nailer, to insure you put the nail where you need to. I've put a couple of hundred Bostitch nails through this nailer and have not had any jams. Pay particular attention to the pressure, as it will throw a nail too deep into your trim or whatever you use it for. Properly adjusted and tested on scrap wood, you will get nail after nail exactly as you want it. I cannot opine on longevity, but Bostitch has a great reputation.
customer_reviews.author: J. Treg

customer_reviews.title: Not a standard angle
customer_reviews.text: I own Bostitch Framing, Brad nailer and Stapler which are excellent and durable with no problems. I gave this 4 stars because when I blindly purchased it, I didn't know that you can only use Bostitch nails, as it is not standard as far as the angle, so other brands of nails will not fit this nailer. Other than that it is the only regret on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BillofOhio

customer_reviews.title: An extremely good value
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this unit to install hardwood flooring as well as for frames. The unit is very reliable and performs exceptionally well. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a high quality finishing nailer.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewerMS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great gun, but make sure you notice the nails.
customer_reviews.text: I got this and love everything about it. It was a lot cheaper than most other placers, but it is the FN nail model. I had to go to two different hardware stores to find the nails. If you are grabbing it from Amazon may be worth getting the FN nails here too.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great gun for your arsenal
customer_reviews.text: I love this gun. I've used it around the house to do light and medium duty work and it performs flawlessly. Setting the adjustable depth gauge for the nail head height takes a little trial and error, but the gun is absolutely outstanding. The range of size of nail this thing can handle allows it to do most of anything the average weekend warrior will throw at it. It's well make and performs beautifully. I paired it with a Bostitch trim air compressor and neither have let me down.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cerruto

customer_reviews.title: Would not work right out of box.
customer_reviews.text: Gun would not feed One nail then would not feed. Went thru all steps in guide book and called customer service. Item returned. This is just a string of problems with Bostitch. I purchased this item because of the price. Won't make that mistake again. I am through with Bostitch. I have several of their brad nailers. Have had issue with pistons on all of them. In the past I could purchase parts and repair. Have one that is 3 years old and parts are discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: REN Marketing, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Bostitch angle nailer. My first one lasted 21 years. I would have rebuilt it but they don't make the rebuild kit for it any longer. I recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Weimortz

customer_reviews.title: Great to use, though non-stanley nails jammed
customer_reviews.text: The features are great, and stupid little things like a pencil sharpener and a blower that works at the pinpoint actually make a difference in workflow. Even though it is relatively large compared to other brands, it has never gotten in the way of the project. I did have some off-brand nails jam, though they might have been poor quality, as that is all the store had left at the time. Other non-stanley brands might work fine if they are of similar quality. My only real problem with the tool itself is the mark on the rubber foot does not line up at all with the nailpoint, though I have never owned a gun that was accurate by any brand.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice features. The front pulls open to remove any ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Bostitch nail guns for over 30 yrs. This is the third finish nailer I've bought. They last a long time if you take care of them. Very nice features. The front pulls open to remove any jammed nails. LED light & belt clip. Interior & exterior nailing. I use it to install smaller pieces of concrete siding with stainless steel finish nails.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G. W. Vaughan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Replaced my Porter Cable finish nailer which did not hold up. Bostitch was recommended by people who repair these guns!
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Missing items in product case.
customer_reviews.text: The nailer works great, very happy. Product description states that sample nail clips were supposed to be in with gun. Disappointed that they were not there. Would have been nice to try and use different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Emma's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Great jamb nailer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this nailer for a couple of months now. I am a handyman & have used it to install 7 interior doors, 2 sets of bifold doors, 4 sets of jamb extensions for windows, as well as some 1x oak cap on top of a half wall. I've shot 2" & 2 1/2" nails, both Bostitch brand & have had no problems/misfires at all. Single fire & bump fire work well. I haven't used the pencil sharpener & have only used the light once, but the bells & whistles are nice additions. The nailer came with a nice plastic case & a box of 2" nails. I've very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HHK

customer_reviews.title: Leave it to Bostich
customer_reviews.text: All my pneumatics are Bostich. Some are more than 20 years old and still clicking right along. Lightweight with several unexpected but appreciated innovations.
customer_reviews.author: Yonder

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Gun
customer_reviews.text: I rec'd the finish nailer right on time. The box wasn't packed very well and the extra nails that came with it were scattered all over the place (inside of the case). I have been using the nailer now for a couple of weeks and it works great. Very powerful. The only reason I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is due to the condition of the package upon arrival. Luckily the contents didn't have any damage but the packing was done poorly. I wasn't sure if the nailer was new due to the cardboard around the case looked like it had slid across the floor several times, worn out in sections. The gun was new though.
customer_reviews.author: A. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Really, really good finish nailer.
customer_reviews.text: This finish gun is superior! Lightweight, rugged and operates flawlessly. This thing refuses to jam, even when you put the wrong nails in the thing! (oops) You won't be disappointed if you buy this one. One of its best features is that it takes no oil. Just a suggestion though; if you have other pneumatic nail guns that require oil, take a permanent marker and write "NO OIL" on this gun. Not sure what would happen if you inadvertently put oil in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tarynwood

customer_reviews.title: No comparison, but works great for what we bought it for
customer_reviews.text: Never had a Finish Nailer or any kind of nail gun before. Bought this and an air compressor to put in a Bamboo engineered floor in our sunroom. Came out beautiful. Will happily use this for many more projects. It isnt always the best tool for the job only because it has a specific range of nail-size it can take. Therefore we have run into situations where we wanted a shorter or longer nail for some of our renovations and projects.
customer_reviews.author: MiniBarry

customer_reviews.title: Great finish nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 18 year old Bostitch nailer that suddenly died. I had 2 reasons for buying this particular one: the Bostitch brand name, and it would use the supply of nails I had on hand. If this one lasts as long as my old nailer, at my age, this will be the last one I need. It even has a small built-in pencil sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the gun
customer_reviews.text: Love the gun , best I've had or tried, only problem is that the nails are different from all other angled finish nails, which are expensive and not available in bulk or easy to find
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: The nailer description is that it comes with 1,000 2 inch nails and hex wrench. These items are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: You will enjoy using this gun
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer!!!! Super lightweight. USE F.N. STYLE NAILS ONLY...NOT D.A. STYLE
customer_reviews.author: Tim R.

customer_reviews.title: Great gun. Have run 2 or 3 thousand nail ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gun. Have run 2 or 3 thousand nail through it, no failures. Shoots straight. Dropped it a few times, did not seem to matter, still works great.
customer_reviews.author: mikeatnight

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this nailer to face nail my first few rows of Hardwood floor during installation. I purchased a Makita air compressor (Hot Dog), Bostitch N62FNK-2 Finish nailer and a MIIIFS Floor stapler from Amazon.com. With 10% off it was a great deal. Air compressor, Nailer and stapler work great together. The nailer comes with 1440 2" nails. It works great. No jams and dispenses cleanly till the last nail in the magazine. Depth control Nut is not that effective but I used Air pressure to control depth. It worked. Overall, great tool.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: I've used this product for years to install window and ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product for years to install window and door trim and have never had a problem with it. I use a small pancake style air compressor, which supplies more than enough power to sink a nail into thick wood. The light stopped working after about a year. I never used the light. I suppose all I have to do is replace the battery or purchase another light assembly from Bostitch.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Wheeler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Smooth operating and no jams so far.
customer_reviews.text: Bang bang bang, no jams with the correct nails. You do need a firm hand when pushing it to the wood so the trigger will actuate, but that's for safety, so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer to Own
customer_reviews.text: This is my second (I dropped the first one from 30 feet) N62. I loved my first one. It performed well for the 4 months I owned it. I purchased the Bostich to replace a Senco that I had many problems with. I especially appreciate the light weight and durability....yes, durability!! The magnesium case and plastic magazine performed without a flaw (although I was a bit skeptical at first).The nails sold here on Amazon have worked quite well. I have used 1.5", 2.0" & 2.5" and they are less expensive that the lumber yard and the home stores. I would recommend this unit to anyone interested in a 15 GA nailer.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: No Hammer Head Marks
customer_reviews.text: A very good Finish Nailer - you can set the depth of the nail head so you can putty stick the nail holes without having to use a nail set. I'm refurbing my house in preparation to sell it, and this gun is allowing me to replace the 50 year old baseboards like a professional - no hammer head marks.
customer_reviews.author: Bob-OC

customer_reviews.title: Very light and very powerful. Easy to use. Did not jam once yet.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how light this was. We used it to install a hardwood floor and it shot the 2" nails very easily. It came with several rubber tips and one of them fit the hardwood floor tongue very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Tommm

customer_reviews.title: awesome gun i love it used it to do a ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome gun i love it used it to do a couple of patio. worked great! Would recommend just going to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: janet kay roche

customer_reviews.title: A well made product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that I have bought and both have worked flawlessly I'm thoroughly sold on this finish nail gun it works and it works very well. The weight and balance are so much better than other finish nail guns that I have used over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Stever521

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer, no-tool jam release is awesome as I ...
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer, no-tool jam release is awesome as I have jammed a few nails with it (typically a broken nail ream which could be prevented using full nail reams)- just don't force a tool in the gun and you'll be fine. 16 on center tool comes in handy when mounting trim- find the first stud and use the guide to hit the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Runningmav7

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Very Light weight a A++ on the build Quality works perfectly Easy to Load Love the LED Light and the burst of Air that can be used to clear away any Saw dust from the area to be nailed. Loads of adjustments and safety features. By far the best nail gun I own. Lots better than Sears and the other 2 brands I own. If you need a 1/12" to 2 1/2" nail gun this is THE ONE TO BUY and what's even better is the price
customer_reviews.author: Richard Wamser

customer_reviews.title: Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this nailer to give me some more holding strength over my 18gauge unit. I cannot say I've been thrilled with it so far. I've had a lot of jams, I never do with my smaller gun. It's got a lot of fancy features, so we'll see if it grows on me. I would recommend going with a 18g unit if it's the only one you'll have.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer..
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this long ago when I moved into my current home for various remodel projects and 9 years and countless jobs later it still works like a charm without a single issue. I have never used anything but Bostitch nails with it and have yet to experience any feed problems. It is very light, well built, and an investment you wont regret...
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Country of origin
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased other Bostitch products over the years and have been happy with them. This product I hope gives me reliable service. My complaint is not with this product but the copy posted under details. Amazon lists this tool with a country of origin as USA. Big surprise it is from Tiawan. So whoever does the copy needs to correct this misleading information now
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend n shop again
customer_reviews.text: No problems or complaints. Shipping was fast n product A-OK. Would recommend n shop again. TY
customer_reviews.author: V. K. Ching Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome features as opposed to the older bostitch models
customer_reviews.text: Awesome features as opposed to the older bostitch models, built-in pencil sharpener, air blower in the end, led light, and a 16" spacing gauge
customer_reviews.author: Josh Wyatt

customer_reviews.title: Freaking Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I really like these Bostitch nailers. Lots of extra features on this nailer, but the best thing (to me) is simply how effective it is. I resisted moving to air nailers for several years, but now that I use this nailer I can simply do more. This is a great tool that allows you to place nails accurately and well. Very light and user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Item met expectation and received in a timely manner. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic gun!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic gun! Bought to put together redwood wine cellar racking kits, which it did no problem at all. I shot hundreds of Bostitch nails with not a single problem or failure to feed. The gun is super light but quite sold feeling. I can't say enough good things about it - I really like it and I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz H.

customer_reviews.title: Read the reviews, this is a nice gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice gun with a great feature set. I expect that it will last me many years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Skarke

customer_reviews.title: I love mine.
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick on fastening things together. I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: buckhunter

customer_reviews.title: Flawless
customer_reviews.text: This is one well-designed tool. Having a nearly identical model number as the nailer available in Canada, I was surprised to find this one (which I acquired from the U.S.) superior. The 16" measuring device built onto the tool, the pencil sharpener, the dust clearing nozzle, and the light for dark places were all unexpected bonuses. However the best thing about the tool is the flawless manner in which it performs: nail after nail, it works dead solid perfect. It is simple to use, it is light, and it also comes with five different non-marring heads that protect the wood's surface. Just an all around great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Like the angle. Gets into tight spots better than square guns.
customer_reviews.author: Jack  Z.

customer_reviews.title: NICE FINISH GUN WITH UPDATES
customer_reviews.text: NICE GUN WITH MANY IMPROVEMENTS LIKE GUAGE / LIGHT / AND AIR BLOWER / no oiling required lightweight have had several finish guns by stanley and all have stood the test of time and so far looks like this one will also WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.author: woodworks inc

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PERFOMANCE ,POOR LONGEVITY
customer_reviews.text: We used to be able to get an angle trim nailer from bostitch that last a lot better than this one .The new one does a great job of shooting nails but tends to self destruct after quite a few thousand nails.Sooner or later you will probably have to replace the firing pin as it will break off. I wish we could still buy the old verson.Another example of Bostitch outdoing themselves trying to make something lighter and yet more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Libbey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome finish gun
customer_reviews.text: Awesome finish gun, I'm not a pro but a DIY and don't mind spending a bit more for a quality tool like this
customer_reviews.author: Uncle James

customer_reviews.title: Stanley Bostitch N62FNK-2 Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Ireceived the Stanley Bostitch Nailer,and i am very satisfied with it's prefermance. I installed some moulding with it. It sure made it a lot easier. didn't even have to set the nails,it set them all in one process. I would reccomend the N62Fnk-2 nailer to anyone. I would give a 5 STAR Rating.
customer_reviews.author: Joe J.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoy using
customer_reviews.text: Works reliably, solidly built. Angle head helps with tight spots. Some nail sizes can be hard to locate since the angle and guage are not the most common used. Saved me a lot of time.
customer_reviews.author: gfh GA

customer_reviews.title: Best Finish nailer on the Market
customer_reviews.text: For the homeowner or the construction field you cant buy a better finish nailer for the money. In my Contracting days I tried other air nailers and lets sat the Bostich air nailers always came out on top, for dependability and reliability. This is a top pick for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, well engineered. Perfect for base and crown molding
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, finishes projects quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Helped us to finish up a long term Reno project quickly and easily, couldnt be happier with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anya L Collins

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this nailer for over a year and I'm happy with it so far. It is light weight, easy to handle, easy to add nails and change nails. I'm not a pro so I haven't beat on it. I've only used on small jobs; but, have gone through a couple thousand nails of varies sizes without any nail ever getting jammed. All the nails I've used have been Bostitch brand don't know if other brands would work. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: F. DASILVA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a very good job, used to trim out an entire house and not a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Super fast international delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Product as described, super fast international delivery! I am very satisfied. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Manoel Atilio Martins

customer_reviews.title: Hardwood floor nailer
customer_reviews.text: Bostitch N62FNK-2 worked out really well for me. I purchased this to install 154 sq ft of Bamboo hardwood floor. My first attempt, and it worked better then I thought, the rubber caps (profile tips) on the nail head put the nails right in the groove. I was going to rent a nailer and that was a hassle so I needed nailer anyways and it work perfectly for this tongue and groove installation. This is a well thought out product, I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Wong

customer_reviews.title: Good for trim work
customer_reviews.text: Better than drilling and countersinking finish nails. Does not split the wood, will go in to hardwood with ease and ithe haed is just below the surface. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Stremp

customer_reviews.title: Great Finish Nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying a finish nailer. This one stood out. Many cabinet makers liked this one. It is light weight, never jams, ( I use only Bostich nails), and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ragland

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than you can imagine
customer_reviews.text: This makes finish nailing a delight! Very easily adjustable for various wood types and even better, very very light. I have repetitive strain injury so hammering is a real painful ordeal for me. This removes that obstacle and is light enough to work with all day long.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pope

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great finish nailer. I still have and use my older one which I purchased years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yama

customer_reviews.title: easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: Very light, easy to maneuver. It never jammed so far - ~1000 nails into it. It will probably last a long long time.
customer_reviews.author: cpetruta

customer_reviews.title: works great. had one like this one 25 years
customer_reviews.text: fast shipping,works great. had one like this one 25 years,so hope this one last
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this one
customer_reviews.text: This tool has been in heavy usage and has performed flawlessly, making my life ten times easier. $40.00 cheaper through Amazon than the box store, came with a nice case. I am absolutely thrilled with this purchase. Lightweight and with the swivel air hose attachment it is a breeze to maneuver and use whether up on a ladder or in a tight corner.
customer_reviews.author: Philip68

customer_reviews.title: Great time saver
customer_reviews.text: This Bostich finish nailer is perfect for the small jobs I have been doing on a new house. Chair rail and wainscoting installations are a breeze with this great tool. Highly recommended. I am using my own air source and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Grant

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best rim gun I have used. 15 gauge is nice and strong, punches through hardwood and keeps firing
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: Nail Gun
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, easy to clear if necessary, light where needed
customer_reviews.author: Tom barnes

customer_reviews.title: awesome tool. very comfortable ergonomically and full of power
customer_reviews.text: awesome tool. very comfortable ergonomically and full of power. easy to load nails, love the built in light. will be looking to buy their framing nailer too.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Deyerling

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't need oil, almost never jams, easy to use. This is a high quality piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Bollin

customer_reviews.title: Bostitch N62NK-2 and accessaries
customer_reviews.text: Was a gift. All I know is that they said they loved it when gift was opened. That is all the information I can give.
customer_reviews.author: Jean M. Coolis

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in 2008. Never had one issue with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable tool
customer_reviews.text: replaced a similar nailer that was 20+ years old. Hope this one lasts as well. The belt hook is a plus and use the pencil sharpener daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, although it has too many extra toys on it for me.
customer_reviews.author: robert l walls

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on this nailer, and it works VERY well.
customer_reviews.author: Gee Jonez

customer_reviews.title: Awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: I was installing tongue and groove in my house and needed a little help and this machine was more than I expected, I would diffinitely recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Judy Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Works good but wish it was a little beefier.
customer_reviews.text: A decent nail gun, would get 5 stars if it didn't have some plastic parts. Would look at another brand for full time job site use,
customer_reviews.author: Locust.

customer_reviews.title: I have found this nail gun to be perfect for the projects I need to do
customer_reviews.text: I have found this nail gun to be perfect for the projects I need to do. Because of the size and weight, it can be cumbersome for some small projects, but the performance is great. Overall, this product is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Doucet

customer_reviews.title: Great finishing nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Great finish nailer. Wished I had bought one years ago.
customer_reviews.author: ImagingGuru

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: dont like the nose .. not as good as the older models
customer_reviews.author: Joe O.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have in your tool box
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I didn't buy one of these sooner. The nail gun worked flawlessly and assisted with the competion on my project very efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: bought this nailer years ago and am just now writing about it. It is still working enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Marlin Edinger Tile

customer_reviews.title: Angled Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I used this on one project and was very pleased with the product. I would recommend the product to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Drennen

customer_reviews.title: Finnish Stapler
customer_reviews.text: This finnish stapler is the perfect tool for appling carsiding to a wall, the 2.5 in angled gun allows me to hide the staples in the grooves in the 1 X 8 siding.
customer_reviews.author: racnut

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, price and shipping was very
customer_reviews.text: When my Bostitch failed during the middle of a big renovation, I knew I had to get another. All my nail guns are Bostiitch. Great quality, price and shipping was very fast
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Problem free nail gun.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have had mine for years and have built a 32'x40' two story garage and many more projects with it. No problems at all!
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: I've only used a few nail guns, borrowed from professionals I know, so they were top notch. This is the easiest loading and lightest gun I have used with a very wide range of nails. I would recommend this gun to anyone, including my professional friends.
customer_reviews.author: A. Boccio

customer_reviews.title: Came highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My husband was looking for a pneumatic finish nailer to attach some floor moulding to plaster walls. After doing extensive research online, we choose this N62FNK-2. He was very pleased with the ease of operation, the features included, and the overall product. Note, that the Bostitch nailer only accepts Bostitch nails. You may want to assure that you can pick-up some either locally, or purchase some online. Our local home improvement superstore didn't sell this item anywhere in our home state. The price off Amazon was much cheaper, had free shipping, and was tax-free.
customer_reviews.author: B. Koehler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel and easy to use. No jams with all brands of nails.

customer_reviews.text: Cant complain about bostitch good design very light and has some bells and whistles that i may use from time to time

customer_reviews.text: Within several hours after receiving the nail gun I finished the trim in my house. It is light weight and easy to use.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price
customer_reviews.text: Nailer has worked flawlessly thus far. Using it to install Hardiplank. Easy to load and to use. Lightweight. Amazon's price made the nailer cheaper than an off brand.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F.

customer_reviews.title: Bostitch Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: I put the nailer to work right out of the box and it worked flawlessly installing new baseboard. Wish I would have bought this gun years ago!

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Finish Nailing
customer_reviews.text: This is the gun for exterior trim work and heavy duty cabinetry , shelving, etc. It is dependable and easy to use

customer_reviews.title: Great Gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a great nail gun. My only complaint is that it didn't come with the rapid-fire triggering mechanism. Other than that, really a great nailgun. My most used nailgun to date.

customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool. Shoots perfect every time. I've been using it everyday on my jobs but most of all I'm so impress how it handles oak wood.

product_meta.title: BOSTITCH Finish Nailer, Angled, 15GA, 1-1/4-Inch to 2-1/2-Inch (N62FNK2)
product_meta.description:
Oil-free operation requires no regular maintenance and eliminates the risk of oil stains. Lightweight magnesium design for added durability. Adjustable depth guide sets nails to desired depths quickly and conveniently. Tool-free removable magazine for fast cleaning and jam clearing. Specs: Height: 11.63"; Length: 140.69"; Width: 3.13"; Weight: 3.8 lbs: Driving Power: 400 Inch Lbs.; Magazine Capacity: 130 Nails; Operating Pressure: 70-120 PSI; Thread Fitting Type: 1/4" NPT. Includes: Finish Nailer; (1,000) 2" Nails; Carrying Case; Hex Wrenches and Four Profile Tips.

AMAZON.COM
Put the finishing touches on your projects with the Bostitch N62FNK-2 Angled Finish Nailer. A magnesium body makes this nailer durable and lightweight, and oil-free maintenance and an easy-load magazine make it easy to use. Adjustable settings let you set the perfect nail depth for the job, whether you're working with furniture, molding, or trim.




The Bostitch N62FNK-2 
Angled Finish Nailer 
At a Glance: * 400 in./lbs. of driving power
 * Adjustable nail depth
 * Lightweight, durable magnesium housing
 * Includes four profile tips and sample fasteners

1.25" to 2.5" nails are ideal for furniture projects or trim work. View larger.

With its lightweight magnesium 
body, this nailer is perfect for
over-the-head jobs. View larger.

Angled profile tips help you drive nails at the proper depth and angle.
View larger.Give Your Home a Professional Finish
The N62FNK-2 Finishing Nailer is the perfect tool for tackling the detail work that makes your home stand out. Use this nailer with a standard air compressor to add trim around windows and doors, apply crown molding, or work on furniture projects. For a pristine finish, a choice of four angled profile tips ensures the perfect drive every time. Also, this nailer features oil-free operation, so it's easy to maintain and it won't stain your workpieces.Adjustable to Match the Task at Hand
The N62FNK-2 has adjustable nail-depth settings and an operating range of 70 to 120 PSI, which means you can dial in the right depth for the job quickly and easily. And with a driving power of 400 in/lbs, you can easily set 15-gauge finishing nails into even the most challenging hardwoods with power to spare.

Additionally, the N62FNK-2 has a tool-free magazine that holds 130 nails (1.25-inches to 2.5-inches in length), so you can knock out plenty of work in a single load. For added convenience, the magazine removes easily for cleaning and jam clearing.

Lightweight, Durable Construction for Everyday Use
The magnesium construction of the N62FNK-2 Angled Finish Nailer means this tool is light enough to use all day, while still being strong enough to reliably use again and again. Measuring 3.13 x 11.63 x 14.69 inches (WxHxL) and weighing just 3.8 pounds, this tool is perfect for over-the-head jobs, such as mounting crown molding, hanging shutters, installing cabinets, and more.

When you've finished the job, the N66C-1 and profile tips store neatly in a protective carrying case.

The Bostitch N62FNK-2 Angled Finish Nailer is backed by a seven-year limited warranty.

About Bostitch
Stanley-Bostitch manufactures top-quality, innovative fastening tools and fasteners for industrial, construction, and home-improvement applications. Products include pneumatic staplers and nailers; compressors; manual staplers and tackers; coil-fed screw systems; rivet tools; glue guns; a broad assortment of collated nails, screws, staples and specialty fasteners in a variety of materials and finishes; and carton-closing staplers--many of them industry firsts.

What's in the Box
Includes the finish nailer, no-mar tips, four profile tips, fasteners, and a durable carrying case.




FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This finish nail driver comes in a magnesium housing, making it durable although it weighs only 3.8-pounds--the lightest angled finish nailer available. The tool's oil-free engine requires no lubrication and cannot stain work surfaces. It features 400-inch-pounds of driving power--the highest power-to-weight ratio available. Drives BFN-style finish nails from 1 to 2-1/2-inches long. tool-free removable magazine allows easy jam clearing and cleaning. Inline magazine provides greater accuracy. Also features tool-free depth control for quick countersinking adjustments and tool-free adjustable exhaust for directing airflow. Kit includes no-mar tip, fasteners, and carrying case.

See more
